quickStart.description: Get started with Lokus in Claude Desktop
steps: 1. Install Lokus and ensure it's running
2. Generate an API key in Lokus Preferences
3. Update LOKUS_API_KEY in this config file
4. Update workspace path to your Lokus directory
6. Try: 'List my recent notes from Lokus'

connection_failed.description: Cannot connect to Lokus MCP server
solutions: Verify Lokus is running and MCP server is enabled
Check that port 3001 is not blocked by firewall
Ensure API key is correct and has proper permissions
Try restarting both Lokus and Claude Desktop
Generate a new API key in Lokus Preferences
Verify the key is correctly set in LOKUS_API_KEY
Check that the API key hasn't expired
Ensure the key has necessary permissions
Check file permissions on workspace directory
Verify API key has write permissions if needed
Reduce workspace size or use selective indexing
Adjust rate limits in server settings

debug_commands: Check server status: View Lokus preferences MCP tab
Validate config: Use Claude Desktop's MCP validation tool

custom_tools.description: How to add custom tools to your Lokus MCP server
steps: 1. Create a plugin in Lokus with MCP tool definitions
2. Register tools using the MCPProtocol.registerTool() method
3. Implement tool execution logic in your plugin
4. Test tools using the MCP client examples
5. Tools will automatically appear in Claude Desktop
